page.title: 02Land Use around Bevington
page.content:
The main activity in this area is Dairy and Sheep farming with some land being used to grow hay and straw. Some of the land is cultivated but most is left as rough pasture for the animals to graze in.
All of the fields are divided up using ditches and hedges _ there are no stone walls as seen around other parts of Gloucestershire _ and all are well served by drainage ditches.
Ten seperate farms were counted in this area.
There are a few scattered houses in the area - most of which occur in the small villages of Bevington, Hill and Upper Hill - none of which contains more than 6 houses.
